character_trait_levels.colour_text: Terribly hurt in a failed assassination, this man has the courage to carry on.
Repeated attempts on this man's life have taken a terrible toll.
This man seldom misses a meal, whether invited or not.
Mice in rice warehouses have more respect for their stomachs than this man.
This man's appetite when eating would shame a shark!
Women are a pleasure in life.
Women! What other pleasure compares?
"Quiet, woman. But don't just lie there like a fish!"
Women are a pleasure in life.
Women! What other pleasure compares?
"Quiet, woman. But don't just lie there like a fish!"
"Crucifixion. A most excellent lesson."
This lord relishes the chance to punish a village or two.
There is more to the art of rulership, possibly, than killing anyone who disagrees.
This lord will listen attentively to foreign ideas.
This lord has an unnatural interest in foreign ways.
This lord is mad: he favours foreigners and their ill-mannered, unwashed ways!
When you wake up with a knife at your throat, some suspicions are justified.
Trust is no longer in this man's nature.
Strangers should be doubted. Friends should be watched.
Without peace, men cannot live harmoniously.
Only in peace will this man find contentment.
Peace is the only way for Japan!
A lucky escape is a good omen.
Someone, or something, watches over this man.
"I am protected. I will always be protected!"
The pure light of the heavens shines in this man's every movement.
"No. No. No."
"Lord Buddha! Have you had a bath this year?"
"I'll wager you rarely trouble the ladies, unlike me! Ha!"
"I am the exemplar of justice. Say different again, and you lose your tongue!"
Spare the rod and spoil the peasant.
"Enough! Enough! Have them killed."
A man with steel in his soul does not stop for snow or celebration.
This woman's looks come from her make-up box, thanks to the assassin's blade.
Thanks to failed attempts on her life, this woman will never be the same again.
The fox can learn new tricks.
Novelty will always attract men.
Always dutiful, but aware of his own needs and desires.
Ambition gnaws at this man's heart.
Others are only useful as long as they further this man's ambitions.
A little killing is part of warfare.
A lot of killing saves work later.
Kill them all, and tomorrow will be better!
This man has a reputation for going into harm's way.
This man's name is a byword for honest courage in battle.
This man is a god of battles!
"The old ways have served Japan well."
A man who changes ceases to be a man.
There are many good reasons not to change. Ever.
This man's ancestors must be disappointed.
Whispers about this man's bravery follow him everywhere.
No shrine will be erected for a coward.
"Aye, there's sake, but champagne's more fun!"
A dram steadies the hand and stiffens the sinew.
"Bloody bottle's empty!"
Some nightmares can only be drowned in sake.
The heart aches for love, now winter's chill comes early: an empty bottle.
For this man, the clan is all.
Even by the code of bushido, this man has noteworthy loyalty.
This man would die for his lord, his clan and his family, preferably in that order.
"Look: my katana is sharper, so there's nothing wrong in me having fish down my hakama."
"I need moonlight. In moonlight, blood looks like ink, did you know that? I like poetry."
"I'm a little tea bowl, round and black…"
Some losses pierce the soul, and turn the mind.
This man is an empty shell, hollowed by grief and sorrow.
The death of loved ones has worn away this man's grip on reality.
A cannon shell has a glory all its own.
Why settle for a thousand enemy deaths?
The new, the polished, and the deadly: all appeal.
Darkness holds no terrors.
All that glitters is not gold.
Some things should never change.
This man pines for the days of his youth, when the world was honest.
When you wake up with a knife at your throat, some suspicions are justified.
Trust is no longer in this man's nature.
Strangers should be doubted. Friends should be watched.
A lucky escape is a good omen.
Someone, or something, watches over this man.
"I am protected. I will always be protected!"
"Bastards. Fish. Fishy bastards. YERRRRKK!"
"Spirits of the sea! Torture me no more!"
"O gods! Have we left harbour yet?"
"I serve the Imperial Throne! Nothing more!"
Traitors are everywhere. Absolutely everywhere.
Sometimes loyalty goes unmarked.
The just blade always feels cruel to the neck.
As long as the Emperor is served...
Anything can be contemplated in the Emperor's name.
A ready smile and a joke can take a man far.
Diplomacy is the art of the possible.
This man could out-argue kitsune!
Japan must be strong, no matter the cost.
The Imperial Throne: right or wrong.
The Emperor's whims, in human form.
Watching the light fade in another's eyes is magical.
Death is this man's pleasure in life.
Every killing needs a keepsake.
Some men pollute the land.
They die almost like real men.
"...Is far away. Or dead. Preferably both."
All swords are sharp.
A man can be mastered by gold.
Wolves do not leave the flock alone.
Only fools rush into an uncertain future.
Others are always at fault.
There is nothing left to love.
The blade always feels cruel to the neck.
As long as the Shogun is served...
Anything can be contemplated in the Shogun's name.
All men are happy in the right place.
The people need rulers. Then there is harmony.
Japan has a destiny, and will succeed.
Whatever the Shogun needs, the Shogun shall have.
The sword in the hand of the virtuous is ever-loyal.
Anything can be done in the name of loyalty.
"Aye, there's sake, but champagne's more fun!"
A dram steadies the hand and stiffens the sinew.
"Bloody bottle's empty!"
"These people...ah, what we must do for them..."
Some places need firm, colonial government.
"Quite frankly, we will be ruling here even a century from now."
"I could live here when all this is over..."
"Here, I can start again, afresh..."
"This is home."
"O! For a view without a paddy field!"
"I never want to see another blasted chopstick again."
"Bloody place. Bloody natives. Bloody samurai."
Let the other man die for his country.
"You have to be alive to be paid."
"Always have a fast horse waiting, just in case..."
"Not for me, thank you."
"Never touch the filthy stuff..."
"I have an inspiring book on the subject..."
"My love, we can do so much better…"
An adornment to any man's household.
"Wait. Watch. Listen!"
"Yes, my lord."
This lady has good, child-bearing hips.
This lady is blessed with a strong constitution.
"It's not mean. It's sensible, dear."
"My lord, if we are not loyal, what are we?"
"But that is so beautiful! I must have it!"
"All the other generals are better than you…"
"Why didn't I listen to mother and marry a man?"

Repeated attempts on this man's life have taken a terrible toll.
This man seldom misses a meal, whether invited or not.

Women! What other pleasure compares?

There is more to the art of rulership, possibly, than killing anyone who disagrees.
This lord will listen attentively to foreign ideas.
This lord has an unnatural interest in foreign ways.
This lord is mad: he favours foreigners and their ill-mannered, unwashed ways!

Trust is no longer in this man's nature.

Only in peace will this man find contentment.
Peace is the only way for Japan!
A lucky escape is a good omen.

"I am protected. I will always be protected!"
The pure light of the heavens shines in this man's every movement.
"No. No. No."
"Lord Buddha! Have you had a bath this year?"
"I'll wager you rarely trouble the ladies, unlike me! Ha!"
"I am the exemplar of justice. Say different again, and you lose your tongue!"

"Enough! Enough! Have them killed."

Thanks to failed attempts on her life, this woman will never be the same again.
The pure light of the heavens shines in this man's every movement.
Always dutiful, but aware of his own needs and desires.
Ambition gnaws at this man's heart.
Others are only useful as long as they further this man's ambitions.
A little killing is part of warfare.
A lot of killing saves work later.
Kill them all, and tomorrow will be better!
This man has a reputation for going into harm's way.
This man's name is a byword for honest courage in battle.
This man is a god of battles!
This man's ancestors must be disappointed.
Whispers about this man's bravery follow him everywhere.
No shrine will be erected for a coward.
There's nothing wrong with one sip of sake.
There's little wrong with a cup of sake, with friends.
"My sword is still steady. Nothing more matters."
Some nightmares can only be drowned in sake.
The heart aches for love, now winter's chill comes early: an empty bottle.
The blade's edge marks a line of salvation.
The fire of faith tempers the sword of the soul.
"I will fight, or die a martyr!"
"Now, are you truly… happy… to support our work?"
Gold is not sinful, except in a sinner's hands.
"Lying ingrate! It IS for the temple coffers!"
For this man, the clan is all.
Even by the code of bushido, this man has noteworthy loyalty.
This man would die for his lord, his clan and his family, preferably in that order.
"Look: my katana is sharper, so there's nothing wrong in me having fish down my hakama."
"I need moonlight. In moonlight, blood looks like ink, did you know that? I like poetry."
"I'm a little tea bowl, round and black…"
Some losses pierce the soul, and turn the mind.
This man is an empty shell, hollowed by grief and sorrow.
The death of loved ones has worn away this man's grip on reality.
Darkness holds no terrors.
When you wake up with a knife at your throat, some suspicions are justified.
Trust is no longer in this man's nature.
Strangers should be doubted. Friends should be watched.
If it can be found, it can be liberated.
A little profit is a general's due.
Everything has a value, once the bloodstains are washed off.
A lucky escape is a good omen.
Someone, or something, watches over this man.
"I am protected. I will always be protected!"
"Bastards. Fish. Fishy bastards. YERRRRKK!"
"Spirits of the sea! Torture me no more!"
"O gods! Have we left harbour yet?"
A little wealth can stick to a man's fingers.
A man who swims in secrets and money should put a few of both in his net.
Money is money. A tool to be used, by those who control it.
"I am a most fortunate man: I enjoy hurting people to get at the truth."
"You will die when I have answers, and not one moment earlier!"
"You will be silent, peasant, with no tongue!"
When drinking, a man may hear much of interest.
The next morning it is hard to remember what treachery was spoken.
"I do not sleep well. What man in my position does?"
When you wake up with a knife at your throat, some suspicions are justified.
Trust is no longer in this man's nature.
Strangers should be doubted. Friends should be watched.
"I am disappointed, my flock, by this collection plate…"
"The money was just resting in my travelling bag!"
"One for me, one for Rome. Two for me, one for Rome…"
A small taste of communion wine frees the soul.
"All those sins. Such a burden…"
"Drink! Drink! Drink! Arse! Feck! Girls!"
This man harbours many doubts. What if Luther was right?
Seen from within, the Church is not heavenly.
"God does not listen, my son, not to me."
"And where does it say I cannot enjoy sake?"
A man's spirits must be calmed.
"Listen, you, getting drunk is very bloody Zen!"
A religious life is not a passive life.
"Ha! Your training is sadly lacking, my son!"
"Stop trying to hit me, and hit me!"
"Now is the hour of breathing."
"The journey has been interesting so far."
Beyond the world's reach, there is a peace within.
A sip now and then steadies the hand.
Sometimes, some things must be forgotten.
"I've seen things, done things. Terrible things…"
Killing is work, but sometimes work can be fun.
This man's assassinations are often more elaborate than they need to be.
Killing is one thing, but this killer drools as he works.
"My love, we can do so much better…"
An adornment to any man's household.
"Wait. Watch. Listen!"
"Yes, my lord."
This lady has good, child-bearing hips.
This lady is blessed with a strong constitution.
"It's not mean. It's sensible, dear."
"My lord, if we are not loyal, what are we?"
"But that is so beautiful! I must have it!"
"All the other generals are better than you…"
"Why didn't I listen to mother and marry a man?"
